noun.description: A monumental structure with a square or triangular base and sloping sides that meet in a point at the top, especially one built of stone as a royal tomb in ancient Egypt.
An object, shape, or arrangement in the form of a pyramid.
A system of financial growth achieved by a small initial investment, with subsequent investments being funded by using unrealized profits as collateral.

verb.description: Heap or stack in the shape of a pyramid.
examples: debt was pyramided on top of unrealistic debt in an orgy of speculation

origin: Late Middle English (in the geometrical sense): via Latin from Greek puramis, puramid-, of unknown ultimate origin.
